page.title: 14FARMING A DAIRY FARMERS LIFE
page.content: I get up at 6.30 a.m. and milk my herd of friesian cows.After milking I turn them out to pasture and then wash and clean the parlour.At 8.30 a.m. I have breakfast prepared by my wife who will by now have fed the young calves and collected fresh eggs.The routine of the rest of my day depends on the weather and season.In June I am concerned with fattening lambs for sale at Abergavenny Market.I also shear the sheep and send the fleeces to Brecon.After shearing,the sheep have to be dipped to kill off maggot eggs.Dipping is hard work.I may spend the rest of the day spraying weeds and fertilizing the fields for a hay crop. I have already planted potatoes and swedes.I milk the cows again at 4.30 p.m. I arrive home at 6.00 p.m. and retire to bed at 10.00 p.m.
